title: Burn of second degree of head and neck
chapter: Injury, poisoning and certain other consequences of external causes
block: Burns and corrosions of external body surface, specified by site
category: Burn and corrosion of head and neck
inclusion: burns (thermal) from: hot air and hot gases
burns and corrosions of: first degree [erythema]
burns and corrosions of: second degree [blisters] [epidermal loss]
burns and corrosions of: third degree [deep necrosis of underlying tissue] [full-thickness skin loss]
eye with other parts of face, head and neck
exclusion: radiation-related disorders of the skin and subcutaneous tissue
burn and corrosion with statement of the extent of body surface involved
burn and corrosion of: scapular region
